What is the purpose of the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace?

The Verus ID and NFT Marketplace allows users to buy and sell VerusIDs and NFTs on-chain in a decentralized manner. It enables users to advertise their offers directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or post the sale of their NFT on the blockchain for everyone to see. Transactions are executed peer-to-peer without intermediaries, and users can pay or offer to pay from transparent or zero-knowledge private addresses.

## Verus ID and NFT Marketplace
Buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all the world to see. Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Accept payment to either as well, and best of all, execute your transactions directly, peer-to-peer without any intermediary necessary. Don’t worry the on-chain model still makes room for owners to select and share proceeds with value added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in a new economy of provable digital ownership. It’s the next step in the evolution of VerusID, the most powerful self-sovereign identity and secure storage model for funds in the digital world.## Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.

How do transactions work on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace?

Transactions on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace are executed directly, peer-to-peer, without the need for intermediaries. Users can pay or offer to pay from transparent or zero-knowledge private addresses, and accept payment to either type of address as well. The on-chain model also allows owners to select and share proceeds with value-added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants.

What is Verus Vault, and how does it protect funds on a VerusID?

Verus Vault is a feature that allows users to protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key. When a VerusID is locked with Vault, the user cannot spend funds from that identity until it is unlocked again. However, while locked, the user can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn rewards. Additionally, the user can still receive funds while the identity is locked.

What are the requirements to enable Verus Vault capabilities, such as revocation, recovery, and locking?
To enable Verus Vault capabilities, including revocation, recovery, and locking, users must have at least one primary identity and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured.
